page.title: 03Wellington Bus Depot
page.content: The bus depot is at Charlton Street Wellington.It was built in 1935 and modernized in 1953.In 1978 a workshop was added.The walls are made of brick. The roof is galvanised.At the front there are three large sliding doors, big enough to allow a double decker bus to fit into the building. Most of building is taken up by general areas to where the buses are serviced.However there are other rooms.There is a tyre storage room, and there are several other offices. One is the information office. In total,134 people work in the depot,they include cleaners, mechanics,maintenance crew,drivers, inspectors,office staff etc.There are two lady drivers. The garage operates TELLUS.TELLUS, HOTSPUR,MERCIAN and CHASRIDER are all part of MIDLAND RED NORTH.
